revised_title: Phosphoric Acid in Igneous Rocks: An Analysis by George Fownes
tldr: George Fownes investigates the presence of phosphoric acid in various igneous rocks, including Dartmoor porcelain clay, lava from the Rhine, trachyte from the Drachenfels, and more. He finds phosphoric acid to be a common component in volcanic rocks and suggests it as a primary source of the fertility in soils derived from their disintegration.
